criteria: Understanding of Literal and Figurative Meanings
Analysis of Word Choices on Meaning and Tone
Recognition and Understanding of Analogies and Allusions
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of words or phrases in the text.
Struggles to identify the meaning of basic words and phrases; shows no recognition of figurative language.
Identifies the meaning of some words and phrases, but struggles with figurative language and nuanced meanings.
Generally understands the literal meanings of words and phrases and can identify some instances of figurative language, but struggles to explain their effect.
Clearly understands the literal meanings of words and phrases, identifies figurative language, and begins to analyze its impact on the text.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of literal and figurative meanings, and effectively analyzes the impact of specific word choices.
Unable to identify any impact of word choices on the meaning or tone of the text.
Shows minimal awareness of how word choices might affect the meaning or tone.
Identifies a basic connection between word choices and meaning or tone, but lacks detail.
Analyzes how specific word choices affect the meaning and tone of the text with some supporting details.
Provides a thorough analysis of how specific word choices shape the meaning and tone, using relevant examples.
Offers a sophisticated and insightful analysis of how word choices shape meaning and tone, including subtle nuances.
Does not recognize analogies or allusions in the text.
Identifies but misunderstands or cannot explain analogies and allusions.
Recognizes and offers a limited explanation of analogies or allusions.
Explains most analogies and allusions and their basic connection to the text.
Clearly explains analogies and allusions, analyzing their impact on the text's meaning.
Demonstrates a deep understanding of analogies and allusions, skillfully analyzing their complex impact on the text's meaning and broader themes.
